wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Frederick Hubbard (October 1898 – 7 January 1961) was a British coal miner and politician. He represented Kirkcaldy Burghs in Parliament for fifteen years, being a somewhat low-profile Member but often speaking in support of better conditions for pensioners.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1950 United Kingdom general election

response: Thomas Hubbard or Tom Hubbard  may refer to:
*Thomas Hubbard (British politician) (1898–1961), British coal miner and politician
*Thomas Hubbard Vail (1821–1889), first Episcopal Bishop of Kansas
*Cape Thomas Hubbard, a headland located in the northern Canadian territory of Nunavut
